oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Students drill outside of Duncan College Preparatory School, between 1914 and 1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the students of Duncan College Preparatory School, during World War I, between 1914 and 1918. Each student is wearing a uniform and holding a bolt-action M1903 Springfield rifle. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.

The Duncan College Preparatory School was founded in 1908 by Marvin T. Duncan and operated by Mr. Duncan and his wife Pauline until 1952 when Mr. Duncan became too ill to maintain the school. In October 1952, Vanderbilt University acquired the Duncan School campus at 401 25th Avenue South, Nashville, Tennessee. Vanderbilt University demolished the Duncan School Building in 1958.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Duncan, Marvin T.
Duncan College Preparatory School (Nashville, Tenn.)
